alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Harnett; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 10 at 9:24PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Franklin, Harnett and Wake. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 916 PM EST, Another band of moderate rain will move into the area within the next hour and will exacerbate any ongoing flooding or ponding of flooding on roadways. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.0 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Raleigh, Cary, Louisburg, Lillington, Wake Forest, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, Angier, Franklinton, RDU International, Apex, Holly Springs, Morrisville, Knightdale, Rolesville, Youngsville, Centerville, Lake Benson, William B Umstead State Park and Lake Wheeler. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
